item.title: Mt. Sutro Forest Walk
item.dc:creator: Alan Daniel
item.description: So we had planned a walkabout on the same day we had scheduled a meeting. Anneliese suggested having our meeting on the mountain. So we did.

item.title: Rue ’66
item.dc:creator: Alan Daniel
item.description:
Don Ciccone, Mark Zanandrea, and Carol Pott all of UCSF will be playing in some upcoming shows as Rue 66 hits the stage. I will be showing up at the Sweetwater. At the ELBO https://www.facebook.com/events/1450917745213557 At the Fenix http://www.fenixlive.com/show/rue-66-3 At Sweetwater https://www.facebook.com/events/1488257348157105 *Rue ’66 is mod minis, surf guitar, go-go ...

item.title: F1000 Authoring Tools
item.dc:creator: Alan Daniel
item.description:
As some of you may recall during Daniel Marovitz’s visit to the library last year, he mentioned F1000 was developing authoring software. Vitez Tracz in Library Journal explains the software is ready to leave beta with an anticipated May 2015 release. LJ Article: http://reviews.libraryjournal.com/2015/03/reference/f1000s-vitek-tracz-redefining-scientific-communication/ F1000 Beta: http://f1000.com/beta Webinar & Videos ...

Read moreF1000 Authoring Tools

item.title: Jeremy Norman’s bookhistory.net
item.dc:creator: Alan Daniel
item.description: Jeremy Norman has launched BookHistory.Net, a series of interactive thematic timelines and maps on topics related to the history of books, manuscripts, bibliography, libraries @ http://bookhistory.net/ You might also enjoy: History of Information @ http://www.historyofinformation.com/

item.title: SLA-SF/Bay Net Event: Building the Research Library at Web Scale: Perspectives from the Front Line with Heather Christenson
item.dc:creator: Alan Daniel
item.description:
Thursday, January 23, 2014, 5:30-8:00pm Please join BayNet at our annual joint meeting with SLA-SF featuring Heather Christenson of the California Digital Library! In 2005, the Open Content Alliance (OCA) was launched by a group of organizations including the Internet Archive and Yahoo with the intent of developing a permanent, ...

item.title: Documentary ‘At Berkeley’ takes an uneven look at a campus in crisis
item.dc:creator: Alan Daniel
item.description:
from (The Daily Californian, Friday, Dec. 6) For a little more than four hours, director Frederick Wiseman’s camera floats through UC Berkeley’s campus, taking viewers into the magical and mundane corners of the university during the fall of 2010. Documentary ‘At Berkeley’ takes an uneven look at a campus in ...

item.title: Medical Journal Goes To The Dogs (NPR)
item.dc:creator: Alan Daniel
item.description: For a half-century, JAMA, the journal of the American Medical Association, adorned its cover with works of fine art. You could have easily mistaken an issue of the august medical journal on your doctor’s desk for a stray copy of ARTnews. http://www.npr.org/blogs/health/2013/12/04/248815474/medical-journal-goes-to-the-dogs

item.title: Harold Varmus Interview in Science
item.dc:creator: Alan Daniel
item.description: Varmus’s Second Act Years after steering the National Institutes of Health into a 5-year budget doubling, the Nobel Prize–winning virologist is now helping the cancer institute deal with the aftermath http://www.cancer.gov/aboutnci/director/speeches/science_interview_2013

item.title: Can Scholarly Publishing Evolve Beyond the PDF http…
item.dc:creator: Alan Daniel
item.description:
Can Scholarly Publishing Evolve Beyond the PDF? http://exchanges.wiley.com/blog/2013/11/11/can-scholarly-publishing-evolve-beyond-the-pdf/ In this video presentation, Gary Spencer, Associate Director of Product Management in Wiley’s Global Research Division, ponders the staying power of the PDF format in scholarly publishing. The presentation includes a brief history of digital publishing, and a look at how PDF ...

item.title: F1000 Journal Clubs. A New Tool for Running Journal Clubs
item.dc:creator: Alan Daniel
item.description:
CL-223. 10:30am Thursday, November 14th Omer Gazit, Head of R&D, F1000 and Kathleen Wets, Publisher F1000Prime will present on F1000’s new Journal Club Tool. They will outline planned features, seek feedback and suggestions on how this service might be further developed. A beta version of F1000 Journal Clubs will be ...
